1.title: Lin-Fa. "The Lord of Cats" p. 13-23 in The Three Ears
1.author: Alejandro Jodorowsky - Georges Bess ; translation by Justin Kelly.
notes: (The White Lama ; 3)

Summary: Gabriel begins his life as a novice monk by vanquishing the reigning bully, Topden. The next night, after a horde of cats has been brought in to watch the temple, the Topden wants to be friends and shows Gabriel how to get past the cats by giving them mice. Gabriel refuses to sacrifice the mice, but rather makes friends with the top cat, named Lin-Fa.

2.heading: Lin-Fa.
2.title: "Wisdom or Wealth" p. 38-48 in The Three Ears
2.author: Alejandro Jodorowsky - Georges Bess ; translation by Justin Kelly.
notes: (The White Lama ; 3)

Summary: Dondup and Tzu undertake to train Gabriel, while the whole monastery is being ransacked by Migmar in a search for the boy. His teachers cut below Gabriel's tongue so he can reach back, activate his pineal gland, and use his 'third ear.' He is able to see the auras and communicate mentally with Dondup, Tzu, and the cat Lin-Fa, though Dondup tells him the perception will not be so clear with other less pure beings.
